title: Explain this
description:
Most people share cells in this prison.

The questions you're going to ask are about making sure everyone's as safe as possible.

Serious incidents between cellmates are extremely rare.

You've run a background check looking at their sentence, past behaviour and any history in prison.

Honest answers mean everyone will be safer.

The information they give will be recorded and may be used by other prison staff.

unknown.title: No predictor data available:
unknown.description:
The predictor hasn’t found any information about this person, so at this stage it can’t make an initial recommendation.

This could be because:

  • they’re new to the prison system
  • there’s a technical reason the information isn’t currently available

What you need to do

Continue the risk assessment, but also refer to any other sources of information available.

You must make sure you explain this to the prisoner and they understand.

title: How do you think they feel about sharing a cell at this moment?
description: Record anything you feel is relevant.

title: Is there any genuine indication they might seriously hurt a cellmate?
Do you think they're vulnerable?
description: For example, they’ve previously been a victim of violence in prison or they’re in debt to another prisoner.

title: Have they taken illicit drugs in the last month?
Do they have any hostile views or prejudices?
description:
For example, they express prejudices about:

  • race
  • religion
  • sexual orientation
  • particular addictions

reasons: Has indicated prejudice and hostile views

title: Are there any other reasons why you would recommend they have a single cell?

reasons: Based on the concerns I have (officers views)
